author: mburke@times-news.com(Mike Burke)
title: Swann, FH beat Miners
text:
Swann, FH beat Miners from staff reports The Cumberland Times-News Posted on Oct 24, 2015 by Mike Burke 
FROSTBURG — The Fort Hill junior varsity football team defeated Mountain Ridge, 35-14, Monday at Mountain Ridge. 
The Sentinels jumped out to a 14-0 first-quarter lead when Carter Swann scored two touchdowns and Ryan Hipp kicked both extra points. The Miners, however, tied the score in the second when Brandon Castro ran in from two yards out and Alec Deremer found Brant Hughes for a 10-yard touchdown pass. Cobey Fair rain in the two-point conversion following Castro’s TD. 
In the third quarter, Swann put the Sentinels back on top when he returned the second-half kickoff 90 yards for the TD. Fort Hill quarterback Logan Johnson would later have a 47-yard TD run and Hipp’s extra points were good on both to put the Sentinels ahead, 28-14. 
Johnson finished the scoring in the fourth quarter with a 34-yard touchdown run and Hipp’s kick put the final at 35-14. 
Mountain Ridge will play Allegany Monday, 7 p.m., at Greenway Avenue Stadium. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
